summary: This bill, the National Earthquake Hazards Reduction Program Reauthorization Act of 2025, reauthorizes and amends the Earthquake Hazards Reduction Act of 1977. It focuses on improving earthquake preparedness and response. Key provisions include: updating findings on earthquake risks; enhancing program activities such as developing performance standards; improving the understanding of earthquake-related hazards; expanding the earthquake early warning system; and authorizing appropriations for the program's agencies, including the USGS, NSF, and NIST. The bill seeks to improve the resilience of buildings and infrastructure and aims to improve post-earthquake functional recovery.
